column2: @DRUG$: Concomitant @DRUG$ administration decreased the mean AUC of total ezetimibe approximately 55%.
@DRUG$: Concomitant cholestyramine administration decreased the mean AUC of total @DRUG$ approximately 55%.
Cholestyramine: Concomitant @DRUG$ administration decreased the mean AUC of total @DRUG$ approximately 55%.
The incremental LDL-C reduction due to adding @DRUG$ to @DRUG$ may be reduced by this interaction.
Patients who take both @DRUG$ and @DRUG$ should be carefully monitored.

Carcinogenesis, Mutagenesis, Impairment of Fertility A 104-week dietary carcinogenicity study with @DRUG$ was conducted in rats at doses up to 1500 mg/kg/day (males) and 500 mg/kg/day (females) (~20 times the human exposure at 10 mg daily based on AUC0-24hr for total @DRUG$).
A 104-week dietary carcinogenicity study with @DRUG$ was also conducted in mice at doses up to 500 mg/kg/day (>150 times the human exposure at 10 mg daily based on AUC0-24hr for total @DRUG$).

In oral (gavage) fertility studies of @DRUG$ conducted in rats, there was no evidence of reproductive toxicity at doses up to 1000 mg/kg/day in male or female rats (~7 times the human exposure at 10 mg daily based on AUC0-24hr for total @DRUG$).
@DRUG$: The safety and effectiveness of @DRUG$ administered with fibrates have not been established.
